title: estefania-website
text:
101 Things in 1001 Days
Start Date: September 12, 2024
End Date: June 10, 2027

Teach English/Spanish.
Visit Oaxaca and document the life of textile designers.
Apply for the FASPE program and get it.
Prioritize and define my personal branding.
Change jobs and be in a place where I am and feel respected.
Keep freelancing and cultivating my clients.
Visit Hawai’i.
Visit one new country every year.
Take on a vacation my mom.
Have stable housing/working towards buying property.
Visit Japan.
Visit Bacalar.
Win a first place, if possible an overall in a competition.
Dance veracruz in folklorico.
Watch! or Be part of a Heiva i Tahiti as a dancer.
Live/Work in another country/continent.
Learn French.
Start learning German.
Take a Pole Dancing class.
Take a Heels Dance class.
Pride in Montreal.
Model for two/three indie brands.
Grow my Tiktok and Youtube channel in a sustainable way.
Finish the novel about my dad.
Write the picture book about folklorico story.
Become a well-known content creator in English and Español.
Take a road trip across the U.S.
Camp.
Go to a music festival again.
Write and publish a book about my adventures.
Be part of at least two PR lists.
Start designing my clothes again.
Produce a documentary on queer communities.
Finish a writing project.
Get invited to Fashion Week
Prioritize mind and body wellness.
Fixed my teeth.

title: intro
text:
Estefania Morales Mitre is an award-winning multimedia producer with experience in social media content creation, video editing and strategy.
At NPR she is a video producer and editor, developing news products for social media platforms. Occasionally she records and photographs at NPR’s Tiny Desk.
Estefania has covered topics including Latino issues, STEM, gender, and identity. Most of her work exists on visual social platforms (to include Youtube, Tiktok and Instagram).
As a Mexican immigrant, she seeks to find the intersection between creativity and representation in media through her work. In her free time, she likes to dance Mexican Folklorico & Polynesian dance.

title: npr
text:
Summary:
Developing and experimenting the creation of content for social media on Instagram reels, stories, animations with text and audio, text-based social media posts, Tiktok for over 20 Million followers across social vertical platforms.
Worked on strategies alongside video, photo teams to create daily videos to represent NPR’s reporting.
Developed a team and workflow to create text-based cards for NPR’s instagram showcasing original reporting.
Working in collaboration with member stations from NPR’s network on best practices for instagram posts and short-form video strategies.
